We deserve jobs.

So, what can one do?

Easy. Trust the people who *are* highly educated in the context. 

I call an appliance repair tech when my dishwasher needs to be fixed and I trust doctors, epidemiologists, and public health officials when it comes to Covid.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine

And anyway - it's also actually far more enjoyable for me to mark, although it does take longer than having set texts/objects and guiding questions. 

This is just me saying it's difficult to get out of the box that's been set for you to teach to - but it can be worth it.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: ... what they have chosen and the themes they have chosen. It doesn't matter to me which way around they go - choose themes then a text/object, or an object/text and then themes - it's how they put together a text/object and the themes that matters.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: By allowing student the autonomy to follow their own interests (with limiters) I can assess the depth of their knowledge, their critical analysis skills, their creative thought processes and... it tells me a lot about how a student has understood the material by looking at...

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet:
...is one very easy way to reduce the anxiety of it. 

Second: I can literally hold the sum of the world's knowledge in my hand. I don't need to test students on the breadth of their knowledge - that's not a skill they need, and I'm not interested in teaching them that way.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine

...about their essays and using this as an opportunity to test run some of their ideas.

Many estate agents will not rent to you if your rent is more than 30% of your salary.

Do I already feel like I've ruined my chance of getting this job? Also yes.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet:
Will the panel think I'm cheating or trying to get ahead of other candidates by asking for the accommodations I need? Maybe. 

Will they question whether I can do the job as a disabled person? Maybe, though my record shows I definitely can do it.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet:
But it's NOT extra. It's NOT being given more than other people or other candidates. It's about levelling, about equity. 

And not only do I NEED that, but I also DESERVE it.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet:
In most cases, I also don't *act* disabled (whatever that means...) so I feel like a lot of people look at me and think "why are we giving this person extra?"

Again, that was/is my internalised ableism (and societies ableism, ofc.).

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: I don't *look* disabled. In fact, although I've identified as "disabled according to the 2010 Equalities Act" for a long while, it's really only since the beginning of the pandemic that I've actually understood identifying as disabled (without the "according to..." added on).

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine

tweet: In a sense, I‚Äôve played a bit fast and loose with the term haptic - because while primarily I want to talk about touch and touch feedback as the most important sensation of religion, touch is enhanced by all the other senses and emotions, so they can‚Äôt be ignored.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: Ancient Greek religion is embodied and situated, and so I think we need to examine it in an embodied and situated way - and the way that people situated themselves in the world is through sensory and emotional perception.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: And this facilitation is primarily led by sensory and emotional feedback. Haptics relates not just to touch but to the feedback of touch: the things we use, the energy we expend making and moving, the environment we move in and though.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: What that really means is that there is a network of influences that shapes people and the divine, and the relationship between them. What this means is that our experience OF the world is facilitated by our experience THROUGH the world.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: ‚Ä¶religious and non-religious communities that we have to account for here - the environment - both natural and built - and other individuals. And all these things shape both the person and the divine in ways that neither of those things can be independent from.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: Haptic Belief posits that the base relationship of Ancient Greek religion is the one between the individual and the divine, and that this is mediated though a whole bunch of other layers - the community, or actually communities - because there are several key overlapping‚Ä¶

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet: In part because the field has moved so far since Sourvinou-Inwood's Polis Religion Theory was posited (and adopted, sometimes in ways that I suspect she herself didn't mean) but what new ways can we use? I have developed a theoretic framework for that. It's called Haptic Belief.

name: Dr Ellie Mackin Roberts #FreePalestine
description: Ancient Greek Historian. @_Assemblywomen_ editor-in-chief. Mother. Londoner/Melbournian. Autistic. Bipolar. Queer. Immigrant not expat. She/her.
tweet:

tweet: @DrFloraPoste @MinxMarple @EmmaKEdDev That is totally unreasonable! I sometimes find 28 days hard when it's really piled on. Like - do they not realise that they have 3 essay due at once - we have 60. Or 100. Plus exams. #whingeover
